item.title: Christmas tree flytipped on street, 17th January
item.description:

item.title: Light is too strong and interferes with sleep, 17th January
item.description:
This light is opposite my house and too strong. I have blackout curtains in the upstairs windows but light comes in through the top, making sleep difficult. Please install a shield above light unit and/or a low intensity bulb of some kind.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Earlshall Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant dumbing of general waste and mixed recycling waste, 17th January
item.description:
Formal Complaint: Ongoing Illegal Waste Dumping â€“ Sudrey Street / 181 Southwark Bridge Road Location: Sudrey Street (opposite our front door), SE1 Waste originating from 181 Southwark Bridge Road Duration of issue: Ongoing for approximately two months, occurring daily Details of the complaint: I am writing to formally report persistent and illegal dumping of household and bulky waste on Sudrey Street, directly opposite our property. The waste is being dumped by residents of 181 Southwark Bridge Road, who are using a fire exit door that opens onto Sudrey Street to dispose of their rubbish. The dumping includes: Black bags left outside permitted collection days Loose, unbagged household waste Christmas trees Broken glass Christmas tree baubles scattered across the pavement Bulky waste left on the pavement and roadway From Friday 16 January, a red wheeled bin appeared on the pavement. This bin is unsecured and frequently: Wheeled around the street Pushed by school children Left rolling into the road, creating a traffic hazard As of today, the bin is sitting in the road. Health, safety, and access concerns: Broken glass baubles pose a serious risk of injury to pedestrians, children, and animals Waste is attracting rodents, foxes, and pigeons Persistent bad odours affecting nearby homes Obstruction of the pavement, including for wheelchair users and buggiesWaste rolling into the road and blocking vehiclesWe have been advised by the council that bins are not permitted on the pavement and that black bags may only be placed out on designated collection days (Tuesdays). These rules are being ignored daily by residents of 181 Southwark Bridge Road. Property management details: The building was previously managed by Look Ahead. Residents have confirmed it is now managed by: Global Guardians ðŸ“ž 0203 818 9100. I respectfully request that the council Investigate ongoing fly-tipping and misuse of the public pavement. Contact the managing agent to ensure compliance. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sudrey Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
